hackathon-description-text: Local Hack Day is a 12 hour hack day on your school's campus that brings together the local hacker community to celebrate building awesome technology.
hackathon-eligibility:
Must be physcially at Local Hack Day @ GMU as a registered attendee, and must be a current George Mason University student.

Must abide by
hackathon-rules: Only teams comprised wholly of eligible participants that submit their hacks to this Devpost, and then go on to demo their hack can win prizes.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=George Mason University, Braddock, VA 22030, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-location-address: George Mason University, Braddock, VA 22030, USA
hackathon-description-header: George Mason University's Local Hack Day 2016!
